content.raw:
Sorry for the late reply on this. Let’s go with google-style docstrings. I’m sure you would agree @{557058:2f99420c-1dbd-4837-952c-82c421b8fbdd} , so feel free to take my word for it that they’re better \(basically: indentation instead of underlines to delimit sections\). I’m planning to take a look at your work on adding sphinx documentation soon - I should be in good form for it since I’ve been hacking on another project’s docs recently, so I am less confused about sphinx than usual.  
  
Happy to merge whenever once you’ve got the fix the last issue.
content.html:
Sorry for the late reply on this. Let’s go with google-style docstrings. I’m sure you would agree @Philip Starkey , so feel free to take my word for it that they’re better (basically: indentation instead of underlines to delimit sections). I’m planning to take a look at your work on adding sphinx documentation soon - I should be in good form for it since I’ve been hacking on another project’s docs recently, so I am less confused about sphinx than usual.

Happy to merge whenever once you’ve got the fix the last issue.
